intro: Bicuculla eximia, commonly known as the Mexican moonseed, is a climbing plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruit is a fleshy, red berry that contains several seeds. Bicuculla eximia is often found in humid, shaded environments such as tropical forests and along riverbanks.
